info.name: Rubrospinal tract
info.description: The rubrospinal tract originates in the magnocellular part of the red nucleus, crosses the midline almost immediately, and terminates on motor neurons in the spinal cord, probably no lower than the cervical region.  While an important tract in many mammals, it is apparently less significant or rudimentary in humans.
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/6 Cervical cord, middle
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/9 Cord-Medulla Junction
